definition: young people decked out in gorgeous clothes (idiom)

sentences.english: In those ancient stores, the needlework is the required course for girls.
sentences.chinese: 在古老故事裏，女紅是女子的必修課程。

sentences.english: The embroidery pays attention to elaboration hard, but the cooking calculate greatly of talent more vivid.
sentences.chinese: 女紅講究細心認真，廚藝卻更看重天分靈活。

sentences.english: New needlework age is seen as an atmosphere created by modern needlework lovers in the new times.
sentences.chinese: 是指在新時代下的現代女紅們所營造的一種氛圍。

sentences.english: The highly praised slow life style revives gradually the needlework.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨“慢生活”方式的備受推崇，女紅逐漸復興。

definition: Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
secondary normal school (abbr. for 中等師範學校|中等师范学校[zhong1 deng3 shi1 fan4 xue2 xiao4])
writing on the ground with a large brush dipped in water
Hua Tuo (?-208), famous doctor at the end of Han Dynasty
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
